column4: Is there  a better way to track CPU usage than System Monitor?  It's showing 100% usage in resources, but processes is showing jack for usage so I  don't know what's slowing this computer down
did you update today? ive seen several complaints about cpu usage in gnome-panel today
yep.  haven't restarted yet because I'm SSH'd to my home PC.
could have been a bug introduced sounds like
strange thing is that it's showing a different user than the one i'm actually logged in under.
if it is opened as another user anything it launches will have that users perm pref that should not be
so ps aux | grep gnome-panel  shows a diff user?
yeah, one of them is a different user
can i manually log another user off from the CLI?
killing that user's processes brought my CPU usage back down.
k. it should respawn did it?
no.  that user isn't (or shouldn't be) logged in right now
that user is set to auto-login though.  i wonder if that's part of the reason behind it after the update.  i'll need to see what happens after i restart
i dont know but id xhost - just in case
i'm gonna restart and see if it pops up again
didn't have any trouble this time.  not sure what caused that, but i'm having normal cpu usage now
